SEARCH
Package com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.utils.exception

Class GlobalExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
com.butlert.tradingcardmanager.utils.exception.GlobalExceptionHandler
@RestControllerAdvice public class GlobalExceptionHandler extends Object
Timothy Butler CEN 3024 - Software Development 1 July 7, 2025 GlobalExceptionHandler.java This class provides centralized exception handling across the application. It captures and formats validation, input, and runtime exceptions into structured HTTP responses for the client, improving API usability and debugging.

Handled exceptions include:

  • IllegalArgumentException
  • CardImportException
  • HttpMessageNotReadableException
  • MethodArgumentNotValidException
  • MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException
  • ConstraintViolationException
  • Generic Exception

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    GlobalExceptionHandler()
    Default constructor for GlobalExceptionHandler.

  • Constructor Details

    • GlobalExceptionHandler

      public GlobalExceptionHandler()
      Default constructor for GlobalExceptionHandler.

      No arguments are needed since all exception handling logic is defined via annotations and Spring manages this bean automatically.

  • Method Details

    • handleIllegalArgument

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.IllegalArgumentException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleIllegalArgument(IllegalArgumentException ex)
      Handles IllegalArgumentException typically thrown from validation or business logic.
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown IllegalArgumentException
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request response with error message

    • handleImport

      @ExceptionHandler(CardImportException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleImport(CardImportException ex)
      Handles CardImportException thrown during file import processing.
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown CardImportException
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request response with error details

    • handleGenericException

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleGenericException(Exception ex)
      Handles any uncaught Exception that is not specifically handled by other methods.
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown exception
      Returns:
      a 500 Internal Server Error response with a generic error message and exception details

    • handleJsonParseException

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotReadableException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleJsonParseException(org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageNotReadableException ex)
      Handles malformed JSON payloads or data type mismatches during deserialization. Specifically catches HttpMessageNotReadableException and attempts to extract field-specific errors (e.g., invalid number format).
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown HttpMessageNotReadableException
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request response with field-specific parsing error (if available)

    • handleTypeMismatch

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.method.annotation.MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException.class) @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ResponseBody public Map<String,String> handleTypeMismatch(org.springframework.web.method.annotation.MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException ex)
      Handles incorrect types passed as path or query parameters, such as non-numeric strings where an integer is expected.
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown MethodArgumentTypeMismatchException
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request response with explanation of the type mismatch

    • handleValidationError

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleValidationError(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex)
      Handles validation errors triggered by invalid request bodies using MethodArgumentNotValidException.
      Parameters:
      ex - the validation exception
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request with a user-friendly field-specific error message

    • handleConstraintViolationException

      @ExceptionHandler(jakarta.validation.ConstraintViolationException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> handleConstraintViolationException(jakarta.validation.ConstraintViolationException ex)
      Handles validation errors caused by constraint violations outside of request body validation, such as path variables, query parameters, or method-level constraints.
      Parameters:
      ex - the thrown ConstraintViolationException
      Returns:
      a 400 Bad Request response with the first constraint violation message
